--- title: "Homework I: Graph Theory" --- ## Vertex and edge sets ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ![A simple graph.](homework1-answered_files/figure-html/fig-grex1-1.png){#fig-grex1 width=960} ::: ::: Consider the graph shown in @fig-grex1: 1. Write down the **vertex set** of the graph:

A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H, I, J, K, L


VA, VB, VC, VD, VE, VF, VG, VH, VI, VJ, VK, VL 1. Write down the **edge set** of the graph:

::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | |:---|:---|:---|:---|:---|:---|:---|:---|:---|:---|:---|:---|:---|:---|:---|:---|:---|:---|:---|:---|:---|:---| |AB, |AC, |BD, |CD, |AF, |CF, |DF, |EF, |BG, |FG, |AH, |BH, |BI, |DI, |AJ, |DJ, |FJ, |IJ, |FK, |DL, |EL, |FL, | ::: ::: ## Node Neighborhoods 1. Write down the **neighborhood** of node **F**
A, C, D, E, G, J, K, L
1. Write down the **neighborhood** of node **J**
A, D, F, I
1. What is the **intersection** of the neighborhoods of nodes **F** and **J**?
A, D
1. What is the **intersection** of the neighborhoods of nodes **A** and **F**?
C, J
1. What is the **union** of the neighborhoods of nodes **H** and **J**?
A, B, D, F, I
## Graph Metrics 1. What is the **order** of the graph?
12
1. What is the **size** of the graph?
22
1. Write down the graph's **degree sequence**:
::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} | F| D| A| B| J| C| I| L| E| G| H| K| |--:|--:|--:|--:|--:|--:|--:|--:|--:|--:|--:|--:| | 8| 6| 5| 5| 4| 3| 3| 3| 2| 2| 2| 1| ::: :::
1. Write down the graph's **maximum Degree**:
8
1. Write down the graph's **minimum degree**:
1
1. What is the graph's **degree range**?
7
1. What is the graph's **sum of degrees**?
44
1. What is the graph's **average degree**?
3.667
1. What is the graph's **maximum size**?
66
1. Compute the **density** of the graph:
0.333
## Subgraphs 1. Go back to @fig-grex1. Draw the **node-deleted** subgraph of this graph that *excludes* nodes *D*, *F*, and *J* ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ![A node deleted graph.](homework1-answered_files/figure-html/fig-grex2-1.png){#fig-grex2 width=960} ::: ::: 1. List the **isolate** nodes in the node-deleted subgraph you obtained in the previous step.
K
